page.title: 11ST MICHAEL'S CHURCH
page.content: The church in Bishop Middleham is called St Michaels. It is a Church of England and villagers have worshipped here for many years. It stands on a hill in the old part of the village in beautifully kept grounds. Recently floodlighting has been installed to highlight the exterior of the church at night. Built around 1200, the church has many ancient features remaining including the carved front porch and the Frosterley marble font. The stained glass window in the west wall portrays St Michael to whom the church was dedicated. The church has regular Sunday and weekday services and has a choir which includes some of the schoolchildren.
